alert.note: Alert for Lewis (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 03 at 11:35AM EST until January 03 at 12:45PM EST by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1245 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of Northeast Kentucky and South Central Ohio, including the following counties, in Northeast Kentucky, Lewis. In South Central Ohio, Adams, Pike and Scioto. * WHEN...Until 1245 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1135 AM EST, local law enforcement reported minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Portsmouth, Waverly, West Union, New Boston, Piketon, Peebles, Seaman, Lucasville, Rosemount, Clarktown, Blue Creek, Beaver, Rarden, Cherry Fork, Otway, Mount Joy, Lombardsville, Ladd, Bear Creek and Wamsley.
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
